bibl.note: This document is a letter written by James Wilkins to Colonel Robert Allen about a loan owed to him by one Dr. Pillow. The letter is also signed by James K. Polk on Wilkin's behalf.

div1.p: by the advice of Govr. J. K. Polk I inclose one promisary note of Doct. S.B. Pillow for $20._ Due 4th Feby 1839 which you will oblige me by collecting & when collected pay yourself out of it and send me the balance by mail

add.p: Capt James Wilkins is a neighboor of mine & is a worthy man & a good citizen. You will oblige me as well as him, by attending to the above request.
